name: Engage
description: MITRE Engage Framework Taxonomy: Structured around Engage Goals, Approaches, and Actions.
author: DCG420

values.description: The high-level objectives aimed at influencing or understanding adversary behavior.

children.description: Reveal adversary actions, intentions, or vulnerabilities.
Influence or alter adversary behaviors, decisions, or operations.
Draw out responses or actions from the adversary.

values.description: Long-term objectives to ensure preparedness and understanding of adversary behavior.

children.description: Establish readiness and resilience to address adversary activities.
Gain insights into adversary tactics and motivations.

values.description: The methods used to achieve the Engage Goals.

children.description: Gather relevant information or intelligence.
Collecting information from publicly available sources to understand adversary activities.
Analyzing network traffic to identify suspicious activities or patterns.
Identify adversary activities or indicators of compromise.
Implementing IDS to monitor and detect unauthorized access or activities.
Tracking user activities to identify unusual or suspicious behavior patterns.
Making the adversary believe they have been or might be detected, influencing their behavior.
Implement measures to stop adversary actions before they occur.
Enforcing strict access policies to prevent unauthorized access.
Ensuring that all software and systems are up-to-date to close vulnerabilities.
Influence or guide adversary actions in a desired direction.
Deploying systems designed to attract adversaries and gather intelligence on their methods.
Spreading false information to mislead adversaries.
Interrupt or hinder adversary operations.
Targeting adversary communication channels to break their operational effectiveness.
Taking down or disabling servers, networks, or tools used by adversaries.
Adding delays or complications to disrupt adversary activities.
Provide confidence to stakeholders or allies.
Communicating openly to reassure the public or stakeholders of ongoing efforts.
Working with international partners to address cybersecurity concerns.
Encourage or drive certain behaviors.
Offering rewards or benefits to encourage adherence to security policies.
Providing assistance or resources to partners or allies in their cybersecurity efforts.
Raising the resources required by the adversary to achieve their objectives, making the attack less appealing.
Provide misleading or contradictory information to disrupt the adversary’s understanding and decision-making.
Directing the adversary toward incorrect conclusions through false information or deceptive practices.
Creating uncertainty for the adversary by altering the information or environment they rely on.
Deplete the adversary’s resources, such as time, effort, or tools, to reduce their effectiveness.
Using tactics to drain adversary resources and reduce their operational effectiveness.
Develop strategies and actions to address adversary behavior.
Examine information and intelligence to understand adversary TTPs.
